App description:
Space Pirate Trainer is the official trainer for wannabe space pirates. 

Remember those awesome classic arcade cabinets? Imagine if those were immersive... Space Pirate Trainer puts you in one of those; fighting off relentless waves of droids with all the weapons and gadgets you would ever need as a space pirate. You better dodge some of those incoming lasers, though, since just using your shields won't get you in the top rankings. Pick up your blasters, put on your sneakers, and dance your way into the Space Pirate Trainer hall of fame. 

Take a sneak peak of the gameplay with this demo experience.

inceptionalMay 23, 2019 at 5:57 AM
The guns are aligned totally incorrectly

Dudes, in real life hold your hand up in front of you as if you're firing an imaginary gun, then point your finger forward so it's aiming straight ahead exactly where you want to aim like it's the barrel of a gun. . . .

Now go into your game, hold the virtual gun in the position/angle the game is forcing people to aim as "straight ahead", and then naturally stretch your index finger out in real life and check to see if it is in the same direction/alignment as your in-game gun barrel. . . .

You'll notice that what you think is aiming straight ahead in your game actually means your straightened out index finger in real life is pointing about 30 degrees higher than straight ahead.

You need to align your in-game gun barrel with where you would be pointing your imaginary gun index finger to aim straight ahead, which is also in line with where a real gun barrel would be when you hold it too (if you actually stretched your finger out to check).

Stop trying to align the virtual gun barrel with the physical grip/handle on the Touch controller or something like that, and actually align it with the controller's trigger and where your finger would naturally point straight ahead. Think of the Touch grip/handle as being more like the handle of a sawed-off shotgun* rather than a pistol, because it's at a much shallower angle than any pistol so can't be used as the way to check if you gun/barrel is aligned "correctly".

*https://www.surplusstore.co.uk/media/catalog/product/cache/1/image/8e94b9347e01b77eb5544a09ce3e947a/m/a/mad-max-sawn-off-shotgun-1.jpg

I really don't know how so many VR shooting games are getting this so wrong--but until they fix it I've decided I'm going to knock the score way down on any of them where I see this because it's literally one of thee most important things to get right in a shooting game.

When you can close your eyes and aim naturally forward and your in-game gun matches exactly the same when you open your eyes again you've done it right. . . .
